name: TurnOver (itch) (LoNa90)
description:
TurnOver - The Card Game

Hello everyone ! I'm Marco and I'm a Student of Santa Giulia Fine Arts Academy in Italy - Art and New Technologies course. I'm here to present you my new project, a fun card game with new and fresh rules, called TurnOver.
The game is currently in development, so expect some bugs here and there but nothing groundbreaking.
This project is part of a degree course so any comment or tips on the game are welcome, I need your feedback !

 ** Game Features **

- The game currently have an in-game tutorial (ENG/ITA) based on the language of your phone (phone language set to english - the tutorial will be in ENG)
- 3 soundtrack from "Bensound" and "dl-sounds" - All Royalty Free 
- 2 different game difficulty: Easy and Challenging
- Animated card and a simple color palette 
- No time wasting gameplay, every game can be quick if you dare to guess the right card

** Gameplay Rules **

Each player receive a covered card each, the goal of the game is to guess the value of your hidden card. The player can ask for a card every turn.

There are two states in the game:
-In
-Out

In every game all players start with the status: Inside, asking for a card will slowly make you understand the value of your card. Multiple and Sub-multiples of your card change the player's status, the round ends leaving the player in his new state.
Once you receive enough cards to understand the hidden card, you can select it and try and guess it.

The game is made in unity for Android mobile devices, but you can also use an Emulator like BlueStacks if you want. Just drag the .apk file into BlueStacks and start the game! Requires Android 4.1 at least.

Windows version now available, play it on your pc without emulator !

 

** Upcoming Features **

- The Multiplayer mode is currently in development, if you want to try it let me know! 
- Brand new personalized soundtrack made by an Italian musician and composer (https://www.musicustom.com/wp/en/home-en/)

Let me know if you like the game or have any tips about it even if you don't like it, I'm here to improve myself. 

Thanks
